pgTitle: List of nature centers in Florida

rows.text: Apalachicola Environmental Education and Training Center
website, operated by the State, features tanks and exhibits about the river, bay and gulf habitats found in Apalachicola
Arch Creek Park Museum & Nature Center
8 acres, operated by the County, museum features Native American artifacts
Audubon Center for Birds of Prey
Audubon Resource Center at Lettuce Lake
Operated by the Tampa Audubon Society in the 240-acre park
Back to Nature Wildlife Refuge & Education Center
524 acres, Sand and Sea Nature Center features displays about local sea and shore life, including corals, shells, crabs, sea urchins, drift seeds, sea sponges and sea turtles
Barrier Island Sanctuary Management and Education Center
Bill Sadowski Park and Nature Center
website, operated by the County, 30 acres
website, operated by St. Petersburg Parks & Recreation, 245 acres, features the Boyd Hill Environmental Center
Brooker Creek Preserve Environmental Education Center
website, nature center and wildlife rehabilitation hospital
website, includes the museum, 105 acres with three nature trails, a planetarium, butterfly and bird aviaries
website, 160-acre preserve, environmental education and hands-on learning center
website, 112 acres, operated by the County
website, 115 acres with pine flatwoods, salt marsh, mangrove fringe and hammock areas, environmental center
website, provides over 20 different educational programs, manages 8 environmentally sensitive lands and provides a total of over 8 miles of hiking trail and other recreational opportunities
7,271 acres of mangrove swamp, cypress swamps, salt marshes, mangrove river estuaries, and pine flatwoods, nature center
Conservancy of Southwest Florida Nature Center
website, 21 acres, new center under construction
Crane Point Museum and Nature Center
63 acres, includes the natural history museum, trails, wild bird rehabilitation center
Crowley Natural and Cultural History Center
website, 185 acres, includes trails, pioneer museum and historic buildings, wild and farm animals
website, 40 acres, located in South County Regional Park, operated by Palm Beach County Parks & Recreation
website, accessible by boat only, 53.3-acre nature-oriented park with guided nature walks, trails, water shuttle
website, operated by the City of Ocala, environmental and science education
Ed Yarborough Nature Center at Geneva Wilderness Area
website, 180 acres, operated by the County
Elsa Kimbell Environmental Education and Research Center
Located in the 11,500-acre Jonathan Dickinson State Park
website, 471-acre nature preserve, management & education center features hands-on exhibit room, discovery room
Environmental Center at Miami Dade College
website, operated by the County, 247-acre Designated Urban Wilderness Area
website, wild bird rehabilitation center, boardwalk trail past aviaries of rescued but unreleasable birds

Exhibits include fossils, butterfly rainforest, recreated southwest Florida mangrove forest and sea grass estuary, area Native Americans, Northwest Florida ecosystems, outdoor wildflower and butterfly garden, trails through 60-acre Natural Area Teaching Lab
57 acres, focus is Florida's coastal ecosystems
website, operated by the City, nature center houses live animal exhibits and hands-on activities for children, outdoor birds of prey
website, operated by the City of West Palm Beach, 23 square mile wetlands ecosystem
website, 100 acres, operated by the County
Exhibits and education about the ecosystem of the Guana Tolomato Matanzas National Estuarine Research Reserve
Exhibits about marine environments and the Harbor Branch Oceanographic Institute at Florida Atlantic University
Provides support for the 1,035-acre Hobe Sound National Wildlife Refuge's volunteer, environmental education, interpretation and visitor services programs
website, operated by the County in 25-acre Wuesthoff Park
385 acres, Rotary Centennial Nature Center features exhibits about the natural and cultural history of Honeymoon and Caladesi Islands and an elevated observation deck
J. N. "Ding" Darling National Wildlife Refuge
5,200 acres, education center features interactive exhibits on refuge ecosystems, the work of "Ding" Darling, migratory flyways, the National Wildlife Refuge System and a hands-on area for children
Johnnie Johnson Nature Center at Lori Wilson Park
website, 32 acres, operated by the County
website, 20 acres, located on the campus of North Florida Community College
Lemon Bay Park and Environmental Center
website, 210-acre nature-based County park, black mangrove forest, mangrove fringe along the shoreline, pine and scrubby flatwoods, educational classes, guided nature and bird walks
website, education center and sea turtle hospital, features live sea turtles, aquaria, displays of local wildlife, educational displays about South Florida's marine environment
Long Key Natural Area & Nature Center
website, operated by the County, 164.8 acres, exhibits on natural history and area Native Americans, elevated oak hammock, 14-acre orange grove, restored wetland marshes, man-made ponds and canals
website, located in the Deltona Regional Library complex, adjacent to the 360-acre Lyonia Preserve, operated by the County
website, waterfront environmental education and wildlife viewing center, touch tank, aquaria
Located in over 100-acre Turkey Creek Sanctuary, operated by the City
Marjory Stoneman Douglas Biscayne Nature Center

Located in the 808-acre Crandon Park, cooperative project of three partners: Miami-Dade County Public Schools, Miami-Dade County Parks and Recreation Department and the not-for-profit community support group
website, operated by the County, includes marine environment exhibits, sea bird and sea turtle rehabilitation
225 acres, includes William T. Kirby Nature Center
website, 51 acres, operated by the City
website, operated by the City, 278 acres, includes living history farm
website, 90 acres, operated by the County
Oscar Scherer State Park Nature Center
website, operated by the County, environmental learning center located on a 225-acre preserve
22,000 acres, exhibits in the visitor center, nature programs
website, 268 acres, operated by the County, park includes nature center with a geology lab, trails. demonstration gardens, observation pavilions, viewing blind
Rookery Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve
110,000 acres, features a 2,300-gallon aquarium and interactive exhibits about the park's natural and cultural history
website, 37 acres, operated by the County
Features shell exhibit, coral reef pool with sharks
website, features a touch tank and exhibits teaching about the ecology of Sanibel and Captiva, 4 miles of trails
Sawgrass Nature Center and Wildlife Hospital
website, 5 acres, nature center and wildlife rehabilitation hospital
website, 57 acres, operated by the County
website, 65 acres, operated by the County in A.D. (Doug) Barnes Park
website, over 80 acres, County park, includes 1.2 mile paved multi-use trail
Silver River Museum and Environmental Education Center
1,200 acres, Environmental Interpretive Center features ecosystem dioramas, butterfly, bird egg and sea shell collections, sea turtle nesting exhibit, saltwater aquarium
52 acres, open air museum, nature discovery center, 1880s period farm, Florida wildlife on outdoor and indoor display
50 acres, features a Florida natural history museum, butterfly and hummingbird gardens, and native animals
website, Steinberg Nature Center, 3 acres, botanical garden
website, 230 acre wildlife preserve, includes the Charles Newell Hall and Museum and the Environmental Education Center
Owned by the City, focus is conservation of clean freshwater, open on a limited basis
Owned by the County, features the Weedon Island Preserve Cultural and Natural History Center
7,000 acres, nature center open on weekends
